title: Revenue Data Analyst
description: BASIC PURPOSE:  Responsible for querying large datasets from various data sources, producing and presenting ad hoc analyses to drive incremental revenue, developing actionable insights, collecting and maintaining competitive information, creating predictive price models, developing automated processes that increase team's efficiency, collaborating in new deployment processes, assisting with the development of optimal itineraries and the forecasting/budgeting for net ticket revenue.   POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:    Produce and present ad hoc analyses to guide internal Revenue Management decisions with regards to sourcing, pricing, promotions, inventory, and/or deployment in order to increase net ticket revenue.  Query multiple data sources to extract large structured and unstructured datasets, examine and explain outliers, interpret the data to come up with actionable insights, and create visualizations to effectively communicate findings to various audiences.  Using programming languages, develop robust tools that scrape insightful data.  Develop automation tools to eliminate manual processes.  Work with other departments to resolve data- or analysis-related questions, including Sales & Marketing, Finance, Passenger Services, Business Intelligence, Information Technology, and various international offices.  Create compelling, clear and interactive visualizations and presentations to enhance decision making capabilities throughout the company.  Use mathematical models such as multiple regression, clustering, and ANOVA.  Organize, plan, control and execute individual projects and assignments.  Provide support for the maintenance of a detailed voyage-level budget and forecast for net ticket revenue.  Assist with the development of optimal itineraries.  Perform other job related functions as assigned.    EDUCATION:  Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field of study; or any equivalent combination of relevant background and work experience. Master's Degree in related field preferred.   EXPERIENCE:  1-3 years of work experience in analyses. Experience with querying and working with large amounts of data is strongly preferred. Experience in the cruise industry is preferred, but not required.   KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:  Proficiency in the following tools: R Studio, SQL, Tableau, and/or Hyperion Interactive Reporting skills. Advanced Excel skills including, but not limited to, vlookups, nested if statements, and pivot tables are required. Expert-level Excel skills. Analytical, data-driven, and detail-oriented mindset is required; ability to not only find problems, and/or variances, but to explain their causes is essential. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills in order to interact with team members from different departments. Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines under pressure, work with limited direction and documentation. Ability to work independently and to take ownership of projects is expected. Continuous improvement mindset with confidence to make recommendations on how to enhance current processes is strongly preferred.

title: Sr. Data Scientist
description: Position Highlights:          Recognized leader:  Rated #1 Prepaid Wireless Provider in the U.S.   Technology driven:  Opportunity to work with state-of-the-art technology   Teamwork:  A supportive team environment that thrives on innovation.   Culture:  An entrepreneurial focus, where ownership and ingenuity are expected.   Benefits:  Excellent health benefits, Matching 401K, and education reimbursement.       What you will do:            Our mission at Tracfone Wireless Inc. is to enrich the lives of millions of our customers across ten different brands including StraightTalk, TracFone, Total Wireless, Walmart Family Mobile, Simple Mobile, Net10, PagePlus, Go Smart and SafeLink. As a data scientist within the customer experience (CX) group you will have the responsibility to innovate, create and enhance the experience of our customers. You will use the state of the art in machine learning/deep-learning to build recommendation systems, build Natural Language Process (NLP) systems for Chabot, conduct geographical analysis of network experiences, identify ways to optimize our supply chain, and more. You have the opportunity to shape the future of customer experience using your imagination and skills as a strong data scientist.         Responsibilities:     ﻿        Identify key business problems and formulate explorative analysis to validate business hypothesis quickly.  Source, manipulate, cleanse and synthesis data at scale from disparate structured and unstructured data sources.  Develop novel algorithms and solution to complex business problems.  Present insights and recommendations to key stakeholders within the business.  Plan, manage and execute on data science projects independently, albeit drawing upon the input and expertise from multiple stakeholders.  Design, innovate and test solutions to enhance customer experience.  Operationalize the high quality code and jobs you develop to produce datasets, models and reports for production.  Work collaboratively across different business functions, communicating complexity simply and effectively according to the audience.  Mentor and coach other team members.  Build a culture of ownership and innovation.          Requirements:          Bachelors in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, or related field.  MS/PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, or related field preferred.  4-7 years of experience data science or related areas including machine learning, deep learning or statistical predictive modeling both hands-on and in lead roles.  4+ years of experience with machine learning, deep learning or statistical predictive modeling.  4+ years of experience in Python, R or similar statistical/machine learning software.  2+ years of experience with Big Data or distributed computing (e.g. Spark, Hadoop) or GPU/parallel computing (e.g. Nvidia CUDA).  Strong data wrangling, cleaning and transformation skills using SQL, Python, or other scripting languages.  Experience with at least one of the following: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud or Oracle Cloud services.  Excellent written and spoken communication skills.  Strong analytical and collaborative problem-solving skills.  Experience with one or more of these or similar:  Natural Language Processing  Computer Vision  Deep Learning  Speech Recognition  Statistical Optimization methods.       Preferred Qualifications:       3+ years of experience with software development, continuous development/integration, and DevOps skills.  Experience with Graphical Processing Units (GPUs) and CUDA programming.  Experience with building chatbots, conversational agents or speech recognition.  Experience with applying mathematical optimization to graph optimization problems.

title: Business Data Scientist II, Miami, Florida
description: Business Data Scientist II, Miami, Florida         The Senior Business Data Scientist is primarily responsible for the development and implementation of advanced statistical, descriptive and predictive models (machine learning, supervised, unsupervised, classification, regression and time series) for business related problems, as well as for products and services efforts. This position analyzes, proposes, and generates predictive and descriptive models and target customer data for CRM campaigns, segmentation, acquisition, retention, and cross and up selling, and pricing optimization. The successful candidate must also generate a comprehensive customer view serving to identify business opportunities and providing the tools to support sales objectives. This person will need to display and implement proper methodology for analysis and model cycles ensuring timely tracking, documentation, reproducibility, scalability, and insights that are actionable and used to improve future business initiatives, challenges and efforts.     Duties and responsibilities include:           Statistical and Predictive Modeling   .     Business Intelligence and Knowledge Management.     Collaborate with the Model Risk Management ( MRM ) Unit with the validation of the models, providing the required documentation, executing back-testing, on-going model monitoring.    Write formal model development documentation according with the  MRM  guidelines.    Collaborates with the data management unit to ensure that the information used follows the compliance, access management, and control policies and that it meets the qualification and assurance requirements of the organization.    Partners with the data stewards to define the data quality expectation in the context of the specific use case.    Collaborate with other data science teams within the organization.    Ensure preventive measures are carried out to fully comply with current rules, regulations and internal policies relating to risks pertaining to BSA, USA Patriot Act,  OFAC  and other  AML  related issues.       Functional Skills & Knowledge Requirements:            Applied Statistics and Data Mining knowledge as well as competence in   Marketing Automation  , Business Analytics,   Data Warehouse and Big Data solutions and processes  ,   Data Quality  ,   Data   Modeling  ,   Business Intelligence   solutions   and Knowledge Management concepts.    General knowledge of   marketing,   financial products and services  , management and   project control   and   management.    Coordination of   multi-disciplinary teams.    Team player with the ability to work under pressure, maintain a professional image and be able to resolve problems and conflicts.    Prioritize work, effectively manage time and have the ability to manage change.    Self-motivation, resourcefulness, initiative, and delivery of consistent follow-through.    Able to work with little supervision.    Excellent written and verbal communications skills.    Professional skills such as advanced statistics, effective presentation skills, conducting effective meetings and research assessment.    Handle large, complex and dispersed databases, merging of data sets, and data manipulation efforts.    Manage project tasks, timelines and deliverables related to analytics and campaigns.    Ability to successfully present customer insights and project findings to upper management in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others, and gains understanding.           Minimum Education and/or Certifications Requirements:            Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Systems Engineering or Industrial Engineering or similar.     Master's degree in Statistics/Analytics/Data Science preferred.    DataCamp, EDx, Coursera or similar institution certification in Open Source Coding a plus.    SAS Accreditation a plus.          Minimum Work Experience Requirements:             Minimum three years' experience in developing Statistical Models, Data Mining CRM Analytics, Business Intelligence, Knowledge Management, and Data Warehousing.    Minimum two years of experience in complex projects.     Experience in the financial industry, service industry or mass market (CPG) preferred.            Technical and/or Other Essential Knowledge:            Mastery:     Analytical: SAS, R and/or Python.    R-Markdown and Jupyter Notebooks.    Databases: MS SQL Server, MS SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SAS.    Microsoft Office: MS Excel Advanced and MS PowerPoint Advanced.     Proficiency:     Data Visualization: PowerBI and/or Tableau.     Knowledge:     Banking Core System Structure: Signature.    Analytics Unstructured Data: non-SQL - Mongo, Hadoop, Cassandra, Java, Hive.    Project management, organizational: MS Project, MS Visio, SharePoint and Teamwork, Jira, or similar.    Web tools: Google Analytics, AdWords, CRM Cloud a plus.     Desirable:     Experience with analytic techniques, statistical modeling, and web analytics technologies such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics a plus.       Bilingual (Spanish) desirable.       Working Conditions:         Sits at desk most of the time operating a computer and/or talking over the telephone.     Frequent meetings and trips among different Centers.    Stressors: Work volume, shifting priorities, short deadlines, demanding customers.

title: Principal AWS Big Data Architect

title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Associate - Data Scientist
company: The Penn State Student Radio Alumni Interest Group
description: Campus/Location: University Park Campus Campus City: University Park, PA Date Announced: 11/25/2019 Date Closing: open until filled Job Number: 92233 Work Unit: Outreach Department: Nittany AI Alliance Full/Part Time: Part-Time    Description    The Nittany Artificial Intelligence (AI) Alliance at The Pennsylvania State University is looking for a talented and driven undergraduate student to join its Associates program for the Spring 2020 semester as a part-time Data Scientist. The Data Scientist intern will work on AI-related projects in an Agile software development team, collaborating with software developers, a scrum master, and product owners, gaining hands-on experience that enhances their learning and marketability. Selected candidates will assist with the creation of prototypes leveraging artificial intelligence and drive the design of related cognitive modules. Specifically, the Data Scientist will research state-of-the-art algorithms in machine learning to identify viable project approaches, design prototypes that connect data sources to a concrete use case and develop code to test the efficacy and efficiency of algorithms against real-world data. We are currently looking for Data Scientists to fill our Spring 2020 project teams. Strong consideration will be given to candidates who can present a successful project in machine learning that demonstrates the ability to create and train a model, demonstrating data preparation, advanced analysis, and useful outputs. Proficiency in Python is required; Experience with machine learning libraries such as TensorFlow, Infer.net or Caffe is required; Proficiency in relevant mathematics, such as linear algebra and multivariate calculus, is significantly beneficial; Skill in another language such as JavaScript or R is beneficial; Knowledge of data structures and data management methods is beneficial; Ability to communicate technical topics effectively to nontechnical audiences is beneficial; Ability to interpret and apply technical papers and articles in research journals is beneficial. Experience with cloud computing and storage services, especially Amazon Web Services (AWS), is a plus; Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes is a plus. This is a part-time position working 15-20 hours per week at $15.00 per hour from the start of the Penn State Spring 2020 semester through June 2020. The Associates program has been designed to provide internship credit for most Penn State colleges. Possibility for internship to extend into Summer or Fall semester based on Nittany AI Alliance workload and availability of the candidate. CAMPUS SECURITY CRIME STATISTICS: Pursuant to the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act and the Pennsylvania Act of 1988, Penn State publishes a combined Annual Security and Annual Fire Safety Report (ASR). The ASR includes crime statistics and institutional policies concerning campus security, such as those concerning alcohol and drug use, crime prevention, the reporting of crimes, sexual assault, and other matters. The ASR is available for review at https://police.psu.edu/annual-security-reports. EEO Is The Law Penn State is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Data Science Manager
description: Job Title:  Data Science Manager    Location:  Miami, Florida    Job-Type:  Direct Hire    Referral Fee:  $2,500 +        Employment Eligibility:  Gravity can only consider US Citizens & Green Card Holders at this time        Position Overview:    Our client is in need of a Manager, Data Science & Analytics that will be responsible for ensuring an efficient, continuous supply of products while minimizing excess inventory expense by developing data-driven analytics solutions for a range of stakeholders across the organization.       The successful candidate will develop, implement, maintain, and continue assessment of statistical and machine learning models used to forecast product sales across our client’s franchise chain. The Manager, Data Science & Analytics will be responsible for continually monitoring analytical processes in production for performance, accuracy, and relevance in order to tune models as needed.        Key Responsibilities:       Must be able to establish an analytical framework to drive stakeholder consensus   Use a collaborative and consensus approach by working with all stakeholders across the supply chain     Collaborate with various business partners to understand demand drivers and ensure data used to train and evaluate models are relevant and accurate.   Implement the necessary analytics project management frameworks to gain consensus with key business stakeholders on advanced analytics initiatives.   Develop business requirements documents (BRD) and process flows for advanced analytics projects, outlining data requirements, model logic, and necessary business logic to ensure successful project delivery.   Provide input and guidance to the organization on developing inventory strategies on promotional and/or permanent items, by working with internal and external stakeholders    Develop, operationalize and continually measure the performance of predictive models addressing most critical demand challenges     Establish strong working relationships with business partners across the organization    Collaborate with other data scientists, business analysts and IT team members to optimize key components of machine learning processes, including data preparation, data ingestion, data transformation, model testing, and writing of outputs to database systems.   Monitor processing time for forecasting systems and work with the IT team to improve efficiencies by leveraging emerging cloud technologies.   Partner with the IT team to apply software engineering best practices to ensure production models are built with fault-tolerance, proper error-handling and logging, and optimized performance in a production environment.   Work with the IT team to source and centrally store key external data sets in enterprise data warehouse (EDW).    Continually assess, validate, and refine predictive models   Take full ownership and accountability for forecasting output and override automated forecasts with business logic, when necessary.     Establish relevant error measurement metrics through collaboration with business partners, and closely monitor results to address model degradation.   Design and develop dashboards and other visualizations to report analytical insights and model performance to stakeholders.         Key Requirements:      Master’s degree in Computer Science, Predictive Analytics, or closely related field.  BS or MS in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Economics or Business may be acceptable, if combined with 5+ years of demand forecasting or supply chain planning experience (sales, demand, supply, production)     5+ years’ experience with experimental test design, modeling techniques, such as time series analysis and machine learning   5+ years’ experience with Python in a production environment   Experience with R, Java or other programming languages a plus   3+ years’ experience with Machine Learning as a Service (MLaaS) technologies: AWS SageMaker, Microsoft Azure ML, Google Cloud AI, or IBM Watson   Experience with packaged statistical solutions, such as SAS or SPSS   Advanced knowledge of relational databases, querying very large datasets and writing complex SQL statements   Experience with MicroStrategy, Tableau, Power BI or other enterprise-class business intelligence platform   Ability to communicate with non-technical business stakeholders   Strong analytical, organizational, decision making, and presentation skills

title: Data Science Director
description: Agoda is one of the world’s largest and fastest growing online travel agents. Coming from over 70+ countries, our 5,000-plus person team is young, energetic, and hyper-focused on every detail of the travel experience. Our parent company, Booking Holdings, owns several other premier travel brands, including Booking.com, Priceline.com, Kayak, and OpenTable.com, making us the largest and fastest growing travel portfolio in the world. But the group is focused on entrepreneurialism, and each brand operates independently, allowing us to experiment and move fast.  Our 25-strong Data Science team is already responsible for a big portion of our success, we deploy ML across the board. Our marketing automation is managing a budget of 100Ms$ with automated bidding, our recommendation and ranking engines give billions of predictions a day based on deep learning models running in production. Our NLP lab is perfecting the chat engine in order to reduce customer friction and there are many other examples, including fraud, pricing, experimentation, anomaly detection etc. All of this is running on our home-grown data platform, currently collecting 1.2 trillion data points every day.  But we are still not satisfied...  So far, we have been using Data Science to  improve  the product, but now it’s time for a revolution. We want to use data science in every aspect of the product, front or back, make it clear to the customer that we are giving them a superb experience from all aspects and empower the entirety of our tech team to utilize our data in real time.  A vision like this requires leaders that can combine strategy, execution, communication and intelligence to materialize these ideas all the way to the customer; are you that person?    As a Director Of Data Science, You Will     Manage and grow your DS team.  Our team is mostly MSc and PhD graduates from top universities around the world, including Stanford, Harvard and others. Talent is the key to a success in data science and we need to make sure we keep our strong team engaged and motivated while growing it.   Drive revolutionary initiatives . You will be responsible for the company future by making sure we are in front of the innovation curve. We will go into projects that have not been done before at our scale, this will require world-class data science but also the ability to communicate effectively with senior management and get them on board. Agoda is a well-tuned machine and any change is tested, making big steps requires careful planning to make sure we eventually follow the customer needs.   Deliver results.  As a leader of a data science team, you are responsible for our success across all products, sometimes that means understanding why some models aren’t working as expected, sometimes it’s about having the right people on the right projects and sometimes is some dependent system that we need to augment in order to achieve our goals. In any case, the responsibility and the  ownership  are on you to get the desired outcome.   Build for the future.  These are exciting days for data science and machine learning, new technology pops up every few days, from modeling to data processing to orchestration it’s clear that there’s currently no one “right way to do it”. Agoda has always been a very independent company, we want to control our fate and our technology so we almost never use “enterprise software” and rely mostly on open source that we can tweak and contribute back to. You’ll be contributing to our strategic technical roadmap for data science, thinking about problem like measuring model’s health, centralized feature stores, orchestrating model deployment and others.   Work in one of Asia’s most vibrant cities.  Bangkok provides a setting like no other: edgy, luxurious, impossibly sensorial, endlessly layered. The perfect junction of a globally minded career and the heart of Asian travel.    What You’ll Get The Chance To Do      Oversee the execution of DS related initiatives and projects from initiation to production and beyond   Join in key discussion to facilitate a scientific approach in key decisions and raise new initiatives   Interface with business and product units to help shape the future of the product and find the opportunities where DS can be helpful   Drive a culture of science and ML in the company, help to educate and train our 1200 people tech team to utilize DS in every aspect of our products       What You Bring      Vast analytical problem-solving capabilities, and experience   Experience in leading teams of data scientists and data engineers, preferably in an e-commerce, tech, advertising or management consulting environment   Strong knowledge in Statistics, DS and ML practices and technologies, specifically in big data environments   Strong understanding and implementation experience of predictive modeling algorithms such as regressions, time series, neural networks, clustering, decision trees and heuristic models, with familiarity dealing with tradeoffs between model performance and business needs   Experienced with planning and managing ML projects in real time environments with incremental testing capabilities   Fantastic communication skills that enable you to work cross-functionally with product managers, tech geeks and design gurus, building solid relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders   The ability to convey complex solutions to a less technical person   Bias for action   Advanced degree (MSc/PhD) in Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, Physics, Mathematics, or Statistics is preferred     #sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #miami #orlanda #boston #seattle #newyork #telaviv #manchester #london #liverpool #york #dublin #sydney #melbourne #IT #4 #5

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: JOB OVERVIEW      The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for generating meaningful and actionable insights to support the company’s strategic goals and revenue growth targets.      In this role, you are responsible of identifying, extracting and analyzing internal and external data to drive performance and evaluate strategic opportunities. You will be working directly with regional leaders in Marketing, Sales, Revenue Management, Finance and Operations to answer their strategic questions and support their ad hoc decision.      The position is part of a dynamic and results-driven Miami-based marketing team, located in the North American headquarters for company.       MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES       ·     Receives questions from stakeholders, understands the questions, determines and queries the data needed to answer them, and produces strategic insights   ·     Presents analysis conclusions in a clear, understandable, and valuable way.   ·     Articulates insights drawn from data to include both in person and presentation of findings and recommendations.      ·     Works cross functionally and communicates clearly with all departments and team members  ·     Key contributor of company’s business reviews, marketing plans and strategic plans     ·     Advises functional teams about future data capture needs.   ·     Partners with Database Engineers to identify and manage data requirements and evolutions.   ·     Documents analysis methodologies.         DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE       Education and Experience    Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or related field  2 to 6 years of work experience in a prior analytical role, preferably in the tourism industry (cruise lines, leading resort or hotel brand).       Skills/competencies    Proficiency in data manipulation (Excellent SQL skills, experience querying large, complex data sets)   Experience in data mining and statistical modeling   knowledge of analytics & statistical tools such as Excel, SAS, Qlikview, Google Analytics, ...  Proficiency in Powerpoint   Marketing knowledge and digital awareness        Behavior           Excellent communication skills  Business oriented  Highly detail-oriented, deadline-driven, thrives in a fast-paced work environment  Willingness to learn, positive attitude, open minded  Ability to navigate from big picture, strategic stakes to detailed, in-depth topics  Pro-active generating creative and inventive new ideas  Good operational agility, with a strong sense of initiative to make things happen  High compatibility of character with the Spirit and perfect representation of the values: friendly, fun, multicultural, dynamic  Good listener and observer, with emotional intelligence        Languages    Complete fluency in English is required   French is a plus

In this role, the Nurse Scientist directs the development and coordination of the clinical research program at assigned entity. Apply today!    Company Description    Healthcare Facility    The Nurse Scientist     Job Description     Enhances translation of evidence to practice for quality patient care   Contributes to the professional development of staff   Provides guidance for the development of nursing and inter-professional research studies   Oversees execution of research deliverables   Leads the research team to achieve research goals and objectives       Required Skills      MSN   Willing to enter into an accredited Nursing PhD program within 2 years of hire   Active Florida State Registered Nurse license   CITI Certification   3+ years of experience in academic or clinical research   Strong knowledge of research regulations and Institutional Review Boards   Proficient in computer programs (Microsoft Office, statistical packages, qualitative data management)   Strong clinical background   Effective relationship management skills   Ability to build successful collaborations across programs and multidisciplinary teams   Strong communication skills       Desired Skills      PhD   Previous experience as a nurse scientist   Experience working in Oncology

title: Data Analyst
description: We believe work is not a place, but rather a thing you do. Our technology revolves around this core philosophy. We are relentlessly committed to helping people work and play from anywhere, on any device. Innovation, creativity and a passion for ever-improving performance drive our company and our people forward. We empower the original mobile device: YOU!    What We're Looking For    Supports the sales team by developing structured sales processes, analyzing sales performance within each process framework , and implementing solutions based on the results of data analysis. Responsible for the development of essential solutions to support sales field intelligence, including definition of key success measures for actionable performance assessment and process optimization. Interprets data, identifies trends, and translates analysis into recommendations to improve sales effectiveness in alignment with overall business strategy. Ensures that all standardized reports and dashboards are available and distributed to sales management. Assists Sales Management in periodic performance reviews and provide orientation and guidance by pointing out key findings and observations. Evaluates pricing structures to ensure fit with company objectives. Oversee the ongoing evolution of planning and sales reporting functions with a focus on process improvement and expansion of complex analytical capabilities. Facilitates the annual planning and quota allocation process with the local sales force in accordance with the policies and tools set by Corporate. Key subject areas include: Quota Setting, Pipeline, Bookings, Territory & Account Management as well as Sales Coverage and Productivity.    Primary Responsibilities     Works on multiple multifaceted software compliance projects.  Performs data mining and analysis on internal and external data sets and databases.  Develops draft reports and deliverables pertaining to software license reviews and inventory baselines.  Provides written updates to internal and external stakeholders in a professional manner.  Leverages templates to create internal and external stakeholders.  Provides internal updates on project status, timeline, milestones and deliverables.  Manages and prioritizes multiple projects and tasks, in a fluid and changing environment.  Clearly convey the results of complex analysis in an effective manner and demonstrate professionalism with all stakeholders.      Qualifications     Understanding of Citrix products and licensing models is a plus  Software license compliance auditing experience  Proficient with the following:   Software Asset Management (SAM) tools (e.g., SCCM, Flexera, Aspera, Snow, ServiceNow, Altiris, ILMT, Endpoint, LAN Sweeper, etc.)  Citrix products and offerings is a plus  Salesforce  Sharefile    Ability to program / code preferred.  Experience with IT operations and systems including: databases, security and networking.  Highly motivated individual that is able to work independently, as well as participate on team projects  Ability to work effectively with a variety of organizations, management levels, cultures, and personalities  Advanced level of expertise using Microsoft Office suite  Expert Excel user with ability to automate reports (Charts, Pivot tables, VLOOKUP, Macros, VBA, and database connectivity)      Requirements     Bachelor’s degree in Management of Information Systems, Accounting, Finance or related field required. Master's Degree in Business Administration or equivalent business experience preferred  2+ years related audit, compliance or software asset management    Raleigh, NC    What You’re Looking For    Our technology is built on the idea that everyone should be able to work from anywhere, at any time, and on any device. It’s a simple philosophy that guides everything we do — including how we work. If you’re in sales, we’ll help you make your numbers and a difference with a brand you can believe in. We want employees to do what they do best, every day.  Be bold. Take risks. Imagine a better way to work. If we just described you, then we really need to talk.    Functional Area    Sales Operations    About Us    Citrix is a cloud company that enables mobile workstyles. We create a continuum between work and life by allowing people to work whenever, wherever, and however they choose. Flexibility and collaboration is what we’re all about. The Perks: We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package. You’ll enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. We’ll give you all the tools you need to succeed so you can grow and develop with us.  Citrix Systems, Inc. is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status and other protected classifications.  Citrix uses applicant information consistent with the Citrix Recruitment Policy Notice at https://www.citrix.com/about/legal/privacy/citrix-recruitment-privacy-notice.html  Citrix welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Reasonable accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the job application process, please contact us at (877) 924-8749 or email us at ASKHR@citrix.com for assistance.   If this is an evergreen requisition, by applying you are giving Citrix consent to be considered for future openings of other roles of similar qualifications.

title: Data Scientist
description: Job Details     Who We Are    Informa is one of the world's leading knowledge providers. We create and deliver highly specialized information through publishing, events, training, market intelligence and expertise, providing valuable knowledge to individuals, businesses and organizations worldwide.  Informa Markets is among the world's top Exhibitions organizers, organizing events that enable buyers and sellers in specialist communities to meet face to face, build relationships and conduct business. Informa has an extensive and diverse portfolio serving several core verticals.    Global Reporting & Analytics    The Global Reporting & Analytics team at Informa Markets delivers timely and actionable information, as well as providing advanced analytic support to all areas of the business. Using enterprise level reporting and analytics tools, the Global Reporting & Analytics team provides value add deliverables, as well as training to self-service users within the business. It is the goal of Global Reporting & Analytics to enable channels that deliver the most timely and reliable data to the decision makers within the business.    Position Description    The Data Scientist is a specialized position responsible for ad hoc analyses and projects requiring knowledge of advanced statistical methodologies and tools. This position is an expert statistician possessing experience with various analytics tools (R, SAS JMP, Python, Alteryx, etc.). The successful candidate will work with business and technical resources to identify, coordinate, and guide advanced analytic endeavors. The Data Scientist will also have the ability to effectively communicate findings to all levels of the business.    Responsibilities    Research and develop statistical models for data analysis Identify and direct valueadd initiatives within the business involving advanced statistical techniques Create and maintain documentation regarding advanced analytical initiatives Work with Reporting Engineers, the Reporting Engagement team, and Self Service Analysts to understand analytical demand within the business, coordinate to meet that demand, and effectively communicate results to the business Keep up to date with the latest relevant technology Help the business implement statistical methodologies for real world, value add results    Skill Set    Expert in statistical methods and predictive modeling Extensive experience in data mining Excellent SAS JMP skills Strong communications skills and ability to coordinate project teams Strong SQL development skills Strong skill with R and/or Python a plus Strong knowledge of MS Power BI preferred    We Offer    Competitive Compensation Package Access to LinkedIn Learning and other development/training opportunities Health and Wellness Benefits (medical, dental, eye) 401K and Matching Employee Stock Purchase Program Generous PTO policy Work-life balance Additional discounts through various partnerships Informa is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, or national origin.

title: SQL Data Analyst
description: Recently honored for the ninth consecutive year as one of the "  Top 10   Best Places to Work"   by the South Florida Business Journal, Momentum takes pride in establishing a team of highly skilled professionals to deliver IT consulting services to our Fortune 500 clients. We provide successful technology solutions and solve critical business challenges to meet our client's needs. Our alliances with industry-leading technology organizations have been instrumental to our success and allow us to offer robust solutions that are highly scalable and supportable using the best technologies available.     At Momentum, we are always looking to expand our family with seasoned IT professionals who strive to excel in a challenging working environment and stay abreast of the latest IT trends and best practices. Currently, we are seeking a professional who can successfully meet the following criteria:       Requirements:    More than 6 years of practical experience as a DW/BI Data Analyst working on a variety of projects in a variety of industries  More than 3 years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) for building database queries, stored procedure writing, and report creation  Ability to write custom queries using SQL Server  Extensive experience in gathering, documenting, and managing business information requirements   Understanding of Business Analysis vs. Data Analysis, including best practices and principles  Extensive experience and knowledge on Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence concepts, principles, design guidelines, and techniques  Experience in designing data visualization, analysis, discovery, and presentation solutions (BI solutions)  Solid understanding of Agile Methodology and Scrum concepts  Team-oriented with good interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with coworkers and management team  Experience with a BI tool such as Tableau, Power BI, Business Objects, Cognos, &/or MicroStrategy a big plus      We offer a great working environment and provide our team members with the opportunity to enhance and expand their professional development. Come join our team and take part in our excellent compensation package that includes competitive salary, health benefits, and a 401K plan. We look forward to hearing from you!     Momentum Consulting Corp. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Lead Business Intelligence Product Manager
description: Lead BI Product Manager  is responsible for developing strategies that leverage technology and data into critical information and insights that can be used to make comprehensive business decisions. This role also has the responsibility of development, launch and adoption of analytical tools and capabilities within the organization.    Responsibilities       Leverage Business Intelligence and Analytics tools to develop strategy for the organization.     Learn what our business partner's objectives/mission is and apply analytics and visualizations through Tableau to impact their goals and objectives in a positive way that drives desired behaviors.  Ability to understand the business context and value derived from the various business cases undertaken.  Develop predictive/segmentation models to understand the behavior and impact.  Develops and codes software programs, algorithms and automated process to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources.      Partner with cross-functional leaders to identify opportunities/issues, create hypotheses and execute analysis.     Utilize visualization and data management tools to create product proof-of-concepts.  Strong interpersonal skills to manage relationships across different divisions within the company.         Create and translate analysis into meaningful insights and present recommendations to decision makers.     Empower internal stakeholders with access to data and insights you created.  Strong communication skills (both verbal and written) with the ability to articulate complex concepts into a format digestible by a diverse audience.  Interpret business needs and stakeholder requests into clearly defined project requirements, functional specifications and user stories.  Create design documents, write programs, package, test, configure and deploy software.         Lead design sessions     with product owners across the organization to deploy innovative products and solutions and improve those currently in service.     Engineer end to end solutions including; data acquisition strategy, data modeling, ETL, analytics and visualizations.        Requirements     Minimum of 4 years of previous work experience.  Extensive experience in business intelligence tools, including Tableau and Alteryx.  Extensive experience transforming business problems into Tableau Dashboard/workbook solutions.  Proficient in MS SQL, T-SQL, stored procedures, SQL functions, SSIS and SSMS (e.g., able to write, run, and export queries in SQL to run complex data analysis).  Proficiency in programming languages, particularly R, Python and SQL.  Ability to create and/or analyze the return on investment (ROI) to maintain focus on activities that produce a return.  Strong business acumen and ability to transform business problems into addressable solutions.  Extensive experience creating models, extracting and combining multiple sources of data.  Extensive experience in data quality and data cleansing through transformation processes and making this reusable where applicable.      Professional Qualifications     Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics/Mathematics or a related field.  Preferred Master's in Math/Statistics/Analytics or MBA with Analytics focus preferred    #LITECH  Related Searches: Engineer Analyst Architect Data Scientist Application Developer Design Implementation Chief Principal Enterprise Specialist Infrastructure Research Development R&D Tech Associate Service Solutions Business Intelligence BI System Analyst Disaster Recovery Change Control IT Operations Information Performance Product Production QA Quality Assurance Release Service Statutory UX UI User Experience Interface Researcher Designer Service Project Software Test Program Programmer I&O  We're designing a better way to work, so you can achieve what you're working for. title: Senior Data Scientist – Front End and Personalization
description: Working Location: Bangkok, Thailand    We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.     Overview    Part of Booking Holdings (BKNG), Agoda is part of largest Online Travel Agency (OTA) worldwide and the largest and fastest growing OTA in Asia  We are looking for ambitious and agile data scientists that would like to seize the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging productive machine learning and big data platforms worldwide, processing some 600B events every day and making some 5B predictions.  As part of the front-end and personalization team you will be exposed to real-world challenges such as: predicting customer intents in real time, ranking search results to maximize lifetime value, personalizing supplier and user generated content, classifying unstructured data such as images and text, making personalized recommendations, discovering insights from big data and innovating the user experience. To tackle these challenges, you will have the opportunity to work on one of the world's largest ML infrastructure employing dozens of GPUs working in parallel, 30K+ CPU cores and 150T of memory.  Agodans come from over 70 countries: It’s an incredible technical creative melting pot of talents pin picked from all corners of the planet, and it happens from one of the most exciting and vibrant places in the world today - Bangkok, Thailand.  Your voice will be heard, you career will make a leap, and you will be able to make a difference in a business that touches many millions in every hour of the day!    Responsibilities      Design, code, experiment and implement models and algorithms to maximize customer engagement and business outcomes.   Mine a big data of hundreds of millions of customers and more than 600M daily user generated events and discover actionable insights to drive improvements and innovation.   Work with developers and a variety of business owners to deliver daily results with the best quality.   Research discover and harness new ideas that can make a difference.       Qualifications     The Musts      3+ years hands-on data science experience.   Excellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and Statistics, as well as coding proficiency using related open source libraries and frameworks.   Significant proficiency in SQL and languages like Python, PySpark and/or Scala.   Can lead, work independently as well as play a key role in a team.   Good communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environment.     Great if you have them      PhD or MSc in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fields   Experience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systems   Hands on experience in data engineering, working with big data framework like Spark/Hadoop   Experience in data science for e-commerce and/or OTA     #sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #denver #miami #orlando #atlanta #chicago #boston #detroit #newyork #portland #philadelphia #dallas #houston #austin #seattle #washdc #sydney #melbourne #perth #vienna #minsk #brussels #saopaolo #toronto #vancouver #montreal #copenhagen #estonia #helsinki #paris #nice #berlin #dublin #munich #hamburg #stuttgart #hongkong #budapest #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #oslo #warsaw #krakow #bucharest #moscow #singapore #seoul #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #taipei #london #manchester #liverpool #hcmc #yokohama #jerusalem #venice #florence #zurich #geneva #basel #beijing #shanghai #ENG #IT #4

title: DATA ENGINEER
description: Job Details   Job Details    Description    Ultimate Software is looking for a Data Engineer to join our analytics experts within the Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing product development Organization. The individual will be responsible for optimizing our data pipelines and helping to design our next generation analytics environment. The ideal candidate is experienced in data pipeline builder who enjoys building new solutions and optimizing existing solutions. Must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. And be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.  The Data Engineer will support our database architects, business analysts, product owners, and the data scientists on complex data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You will do so by partnering with stakeholders/teams and building scalable solutions that provide business critical insights and metrics, while ensuring the best uptime and responsiveness.  Here at Ultimate Software, we truly put our people first. We strongly believe in teamwork, and we encourage and trust our people to reach higher, learn more, and live up to their potential. Ultimate is ranked #1 on Fortune's Best Places to Work in Technology for 2019 and #8 on the 100 Best Companies to Work For list in 2019. Ultimate is also ranked #1 on Fortune’s 75 Best Workplaces for Women and #5 on its Best Workplaces for Diversity list.    Primary/Essential Duties And Key Responsibilities    Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business use case.  Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements:  automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability. Build software required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using numerous technologies. Build analytics tools that utilize data to provide actionable insights into customer behavior, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics. Work with key personnel to assist with data-related technical issues and product support. Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader. Work with product teams to strive for greater functionality in our products.    Required Qualifications    5+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.  Experience with big data tools:  Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc. Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.  Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools:  Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc. Experience with Public cloud services  Experience with stream-processing systems:  Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc. Experience with Business Intelligence tools and platforms.    Education    Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, another quantitative filed or relevant work experience.    Preferred Qualifications    Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with numerous large- scale SQL and NoSQL databases. Experience building and optimizing data pipelines, architectures and data sets. Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement. Strong analytic skills related to working with structured and unstructured datasets. Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management. Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable data stores. Strong project management and organizational skills. Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc. Working knowledge of DevOps methodology and Site Reliability Engineering    Physical Requirements    Office work involves remaining in a stationary position most of the time in front of a computer, using a keyboard, mouse and telephone. Regularly operate a computer and other office equipment. Occasionally move about the work site to access file cabinets, office equipment, etc. Exert up to 10 lbs. of force occasionally, and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or regularly move objects. Communicate and exchange information with co-workers and other individuals in person and electronically.    Travel Requirements    25%  This job description has been written to provide an accurate reflection of the current job and to include the general nature of work performed. It is not designed to contain a comprehensive detailed inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the employees assigned to the job. Management reserves the right to revise the job or require that other or different tasks be performed when circumstances change.  Ultimate Software will reasonably accommodate employees with disabilities as defined by the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and other appropriate statutes. If you are an applicant and need a reasonable accommodation when applying for job opportunities within the Company or request a reasonable accommodation to utilize the Company’s online employment application, please contact accessibility@ultimatesoftware.com.
